title._content: The Jewish Home for the Aged in the Midway area of St. Paul, at Como and Snelling

description._content: The Jewish Home for the Aged was established in St. Paul in 1908 as a care facility for the elderly poor. The building in the picture was the second home, opening in 1923. It provided room and care for indigent Jewish elders from throughout the state. Date: 1950? Source: 8 x10 Format: Black and white commercial photo Subject: Social issues; Social Service Organizations-Sholom Home East and West/Jewish Home for the Aged Coverage: St. Paul; Ramsey; Minnesota; United States Local Identifier: MHS518 Link to our record: http://reflections.mndigital.org/u?/jhs,464 From the Steinfeldt Photography Collection of the Jewish Historical Society of the Upper Midwest.
